alert.note: Alert for Glasscock; Howard; Midland; Reagan; Upton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 7:25PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT GLASSCOCK...MIDLAND...NORTHERN REAGAN...SOUTHEASTERN HOWARD AND NORTHERN UPTON COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM CST... At 724 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southeast of Midland International Air and Space Port, or 16 miles south of Midland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Midland, Garden City, Forsan, Midland International Air and Space Port, Cotton Flat, Midkiff, Warfield, Saint Lawrence, Skywest Airport, and Spraberry. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 127 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for western Texas.
